results.title: Just desserts
results.brief_description: This wonderfully sensuous short presents the rites of puberty as a menu of Italian favourites: a young girls first period occurs when she is stomping the grapes; gnocchi is forever to remind her of first having sex with a boy; burnt polenta is the taste of lesbian longing. A lovely remembrance of an Italo-Australian adolescence.

results.title: The Year of living dangerously
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Jim McElroy and McElroy & McElroy
results.brief_description: Set in Indonesia during the 1965 civil strife, this adaptation of the of the novel by C.J. Koch, concentrates on a small group of journalists in Jakarta, who are covering the crisis, and the strange three-way relationship between an Australian correspondent, his extraordinary Chinese-Australian cameraman and the woman they both love.

results.title: Zardip's search for healthy wellness. Part 1
results.brief_description: This series uses live action, animation and song to promote an awareness and understanding of how the body works and what it needs to stay healthy. In ten episodes, Zardip, a friendly alien, learns about the human body, diet and nutrition, growth, the value of exercise and sleep, germs and how to take care of the teeth.

results.title: The Yards
results.creator_credit: James Gray, Nick Wechsler, Paul Webster, Kerry Orent and Industry Entertainment
results.brief_description: A young man is released from prison (for a crime he did not commit) and immediately becomes embroiled in a web of dishonest dealings when he takes a job in the New York subway yards. Leo gains employment through old friend, Willie, whose uncle Frank holds a high-ranking position in the New York Transit authority. Unbeknownst to Leo however Frank is a corrupt operator who, to his thinking, is simply working within a contaminated system, bribing officials, using strong-arm tactics, and sabotaging rivals where necessary. Leo faces a serious dilemma when a routine job goes wrong and he is forced to choose between informing on the family and life in prison. The second feature from James Gray mines similar territory to his first feature “Little Odessa” - the grimy underworld territory of crime and violence set amid the conflicts of family. Gray builds the tension nicely, especially when Leo goes on the lam, and in his depiction of sanctioned corruption, even if the film does at times mine well-worn tropes of the genre. Cast includes Mark Wahlberg, Joaquin Phoenix, Charlize Theron, James Caan, Ellen Burstyn and Faye Dunaway.

results.title: Zaa le Petit Chameau
results.brief_description:
Ali has new friend, a white camel called Zaa. But Zaa is kidnapped and taken to the market in Monastia (Algeria) to be sold. Narrated by Francois Perier.

Credits: Director, Jacques Poitrenaud ; writer, Claude Roy ; photography, Andre Dumaitre ; music, Guy Bernard.
Cast: No cast information available.

results.title: Zea
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Leduc, Andre Leduc, Robert Forget and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A superb visual trick that will mystify its audience, this animated film transforms the commonplace into magic. The film presented a serious technical challenge because the subject was both elusive and explosive. A film to watch, enjoy and laugh about. Film without words.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean-Jacques Leduc, Andre Leduc, Robert Forget and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Zardip's search for healthy wellness. Part 2
results.brief_description: This series uses live action, animation and song to promote an awareness and understanding of how the body works and what it needs to stay healthy. In ten episodes, Zardip, a friendly alien, learns about the human body, and people and places which care for our health. This program looks at the dentis and doctor, hospitals and operations, ears and eyes, safety and environmental health and feelings. Finally, Zardip is able to attain the healthy wellness he had been seeking.

results.title: Z00 = A Zed and Two Noughts
results.creator_credit: Peter Greenaway, Peter Sainsbury and Artificial Eye
results.brief_description: A bizarre meditation on the processes of life, death and decay, by that stylist of the off-beat and the grotesque, Peter Greenaway. Starring Joss Ackland, Brian Deacon, Eric Deacon, and Andrea Ferreol. “Very funny…very bizarre…beautiful, clever, dazzling.”

results.title: Yudie
results.creator_credit: Mirra Bank and New Day Films
results.brief_description: An old Jewish lady talks about her life on the East Side of New York City particularly recalling the strong sense of community and the concern felt by old migrants for newer ones.
